text: Guanahacabibes Peninsula is the westernmost point on the island of Cuba. It is in the Pinar del RÃ­o Province, in the municipality of Sandino and is sparsely populated. The waters surrounding the peninsula are important lobster and red snapper fishing grounds. It also boasts the category of Biosphere Reserve, listed by UNESCO in 1987. Its western extremity, Cape San Antonio (), is the westernmost point of Cuba. ==References== Category:Geography of Cuba Category:National parks in North America Category:Biosphere reserves Category:Peninsulas of North America
title: Guanahacabibes Peninsula
